mnemonic: FAMÍLIA = fam-EEL-ya - your FAM is your family!
grammar_notes: Feminine noun. Plural: as famílias. The 'í' is stressed.
cultural_note: Portuguese families are close-knit - 'família' often includes extended relatives!

grammar_notes: Feminine. Nasal vowel 'ã'. Plural: as mães.
cultural_note: 'Dia da Mãe' (Mother's Day) is celebrated on first Sunday of May in Portugal.

mnemonic: PAI sounds like PIE - dad bakes PIE!
cultural_note: 'Dia do Pai' (Father's Day) is March 19 in Portugal (St. Joseph's Day).

mnemonic: OS PAIS = the PIES - parents bring home PIES!
cultural_note: Portuguese 'pais' meeting usually means extended family comes too!
example1_pt: Os meus pais moram no Porto.

mnemonic: IRMÃO = ear-MOWNG - your BROTHER is close to your EAR!
example2_pt: O meu irmão é mais novo.

mnemonic: IRMÃ ends in Ã - feminine sister!
cultural_note: Sisters often remain close throughout life in Portuguese families.
example1_pt: A minha irmã é mais velha.

mnemonic: FILHO = FEEL-yo - you FEEL love for your son!
grammar_notes: Masculine. 'Lh' sounds like 'ly'. Plural: os filhos.
example1_pt: O meu filho tem dez anos.
example1_en: My son is ten years old.

mnemonic: FILHA = FEEL-ya - you FEEL love for your daughter!
grammar_notes: Feminine of filho. Plural: as filhas.
cultural_note: Portuguese daughters traditionally stay close to their mothers.

mnemonic: OS FILHOS = the FEEL-yosh - FEEL your children!
cultural_note: 'Quantos filhos tem?' (How many children do you have?) - common question.

mnemonic: AVÔ with circumflex = closed O = grandFATHER!
cultural_note: Portuguese grandparents often live with or near family - multi-generational homes!

mnemonic: AVÓ with acute = open O = grandMOTHER!
grammar_notes: Acute accent (ó) shows open 'o' sound. Different from avô.
cultural_note: 'Avó' is central figure in Portuguese families - keeper of recipes and traditions!

mnemonic: MARIDO = ma-REE-doo - MARRied man is husband!
grammar_notes: Masculine. From same root as 'marry' in English.
cultural_note: Portuguese husbands traditionally handled finances but this is changing.

mnemonic: MULHER = mool-YAIR - the woman/wife you adMIRE!
cultural_note: 'A minha mulher' clearly means 'my wife' not 'my woman'.
